text:
hey everyone welcome to pai's kitchen today I am 
finally making butter chicken the quintessential

Indian dish that everybody loves now for a 
long time I was hesitant to try this dish

because in my head somehow I felt like it was 
gonna be a complicated dish but when I tried it

it really was on a big deal I mean it's a long 
list of ingredients but the process was really

straightforward and it's a really forgiving dish 
as well so let's get started there are two parts

to this recipe the chicken and the sauce that's it 
super simple so I am using chicken thighs because

I love the flavor fullness and the juiciness 
of chicken thighs but if you're a breast kind

of person you can do chicken breast as well and 
I just cut them into big chunks of each thigh I

cut them into three pieces now let's marinate 
these thighs so I am making first a paste out

of ginger and garlic right here okay you can 
grade it with a microplane if you like but I

like my mortar and pestle alright so now it's 
a fine fine paste I'm gonna scrape this into my

chicken to this I'm gonna add some yogurt some 
full fat yogurt and under that non fat zero fat

stuff okay you want nice and rich yogurt for 
this this is going to keep the chicken moist

tender and adds a slight tang and now the spices 
this is what makes Indian food seem complicated

it's just a long list of spices but it's really 
just a gathering ingredients nothing complicated

at all okay so I've got here some salt some garam 
masala now you can buy gower masala or if you want

to make your own I have my my own recipe I will 
include in the written portion ground coriander

some turmeric powder I'm using paprika that's 
just for color paprika is very mild I'm using

smoked paprika as well you can use regular but I 
like that smokiness and this is cayenne pepper or

you can use any kind of spicy chili powder this 
is just for heat and you do not want spicy at

all you can just use paprika or Indians would 
use Kashmiri chilli powder that's sort of the

traditional type but I think paprika works just 
fine give that a good mix and that's your chicken

now I like to give this at least a solid half 
an hour but you can definitely do this one day

in advance that's what I usually do mmm ah that 
looks so good it smells so good so the chicken is

well marinated and this was one of the things 
that I misunderstood about butter chicken is

a chicken isn't cooked in the curry sauce it is 
cooked separately and then put in the curry sauce

now you can just saute it but I'm gonna put it 
under the grill or the broiler I should say so

I can get some charred bits add a little bit of 
a grilled flavor to it so I've got a rack here

on top of a roasting pan and I put just a touch 
of water in the bottom because the chicken juices

will drip and I want to save all that juices as 
part of my sauce and the water is just there to

make sure it doesn't burn while the chicken is 
grilling it's just a little bit you don't want

too much water and I'm trying to keep the chicken 
in the center because with this broiler it's not

very even so if there's pieces on the edges 
it tends to not get as much love so this is

now gonna go under the broiler on high about 4 
to 5 inches away from the element and once one

side gets nice and charred flip and do the same 
on the other side don't worry about whether the

chickens cooked on the inside because it's gonna 
cook again in the sauce ok there ya go so that

chicken right there is on its own delicious 
you can stop right here and have a good meal

but one thing I wanted to point out too that 
if you notice halfway through that your water

at the bottom is drying out and the chicken 
juices are starting to dry just add a splash

more because you want to collect as much of that 
chicken juiciness as you can let's make the sauce

so the base of butter chicken sauce is actually 
tomato so I've got here some diced tomatoes just

can diced tomatoes I'm using unsalted you can 
use salt it just make sure you adjust the salt

proportion you don't have to use dice you can 
use crushed whole whatever we're blending it

all up anyway so and then I'm also gonna add some 
herbs and we have some onion some ginger and some

garlic which I like the base of so many Indian 
dishes so that's all going in give it a flip

all right it's nice and smooth some people strain 
it to get it super smooth I can't be bothered

this is good enough for me okay so let's get the 
rest of the sauce going I'm gonna start out with

some butter yes surprise let that melt oh that's 
melting let's talk about the spices really quickly

so I've got here some of the same spices that we 
used in the chicken some garam masala some paprika

or Kashmiri chilli powder so this is for color 
and then some cayenne pepper for heat completely

optional so these are like your basic and then 
from that point on you can play with your spice

mix a little bit so I'm adding a little bit of 
cloves and cardamom alright so once the butter

is melted I'm gonna add all my spices oops and 
then I'm gonna let the spice it's basically toast

in this butter infused it's flavors and aroma but 
you got to be quick and your heat must not be too

high because powdered spices burn very quickly so 
I'm just gonna give it about 10 seconds to do its

magic oh I can smell it and then right away in 
with the sauce all that good stuff has got to

come out and now I'm gonna let this reduce and 
cook and concentrate you want to get rid of all

the water so we can replace it with that's right 
whipping cream and make it extra luxurious tada

there you go that's exactly what you're looking 
for you want it nice and thick and you can almost

see the butter just seeping away from the tomatoes 
a little bit simmering tomato sauce splatters like

crazy so if you got one of these put it on or I've 
also used like a sip of metal sieve just sitting

right on top of there as well it'll help your 
cleanup as you can see okay the whipping cream

this is what makes butter chicken so luscious 
and creamy and delicious now it's starting to

have that color that we all associate with butter 
chicken this beautiful orange gonna season this

with some salt of course some brown sugar you 
can just do come on now you can just do white

sugar if you'd like so the next thing I'm gonna 
add is an herb that always shows up in butter

chicken it's something called kasoori methi or 
fenugreek leaves that's been dried and crushed

now it's got a flavor that to me reminds me of 
a combination of celery and like aged cheese

it's a very savory satisfying robust note if 
you don't have it though it's like don't panic

it's not gonna break the dish I've made butter 
chicken without it before it's still delicious

but if you've got an Indian grocery store nearby 
that is where you will find this okay so I'm just

gonna add a little bit if you add too much it can 
have a bitter note at the end so be really careful

with it I'll save this for a sprinkling at the 
end a little goes a long way now that chicken is

gonna go in along with all of its delicious juices 
which we collected try not to splatter curry sauce

on yourself oh yes the chicken will need about 
seven minutes to ten minutes to heat through now

I'm just gonna add a splash of water I feel like 
it's a little bit thick right now also if you can

you can make it let it sit overnight and then it 
will have time to sort of mingle and marry with

the sauce and tomorrow it'll be even better all 
righty that is done and the most important thing

is to give it a taste you may need to add some 
lemon juice and I say may because that depends

on the acidity of your Tomatoes you just never 
know right oh good but it does need both salt

and lemon you can do lime juice at this point if 
that's all you have just a little bit a little bit

of salt and see because we grilled the chicken you 
can see the bits of the charred chicken giving it

extra character right now this has just a little 
bit of heat but because sometimes you serve a lot

of people some people like it spicy some people 
don't what I like to do is I just add some sliced

green chillies and I don't let it cook in here so 
that it doesn't have that much time to infuse but

if somebody at the table likes it spicy then they 
can actually eat a piece of that in entire we have

a word for it - we call it Luke door which means 
when you add like whole little chilies so people

can eat it it looks pretty - just the way that 
sauce like sits on that plate you know it's gonna

be rich maybe not quite the way that just splash 
I'm just gonna finish the garnishing with a little

extra fenugreek leaves mmm a few green chilies 
just so people know it's a visual warning and a

little drizzle of whipping cream from a tiny 
little picture that doesn't pour well at all

there we go tada and that is it 
I like mine with rice you can
have this with none obviously or both extra sauce

that is what I am talking about tender succulent 
chicken and that sauce is creamy and tomatoey and

tangy and with a hint of spices but the spices 
are really not bad overpowering I think that's

a wonderful thing about butter chicken as it's 
so well balanced between you know the complex

aromas and the creamy comforting nests of the 
tomato sauce so good just a little bit of cake

just enough spice to give it some character 
wow that is a dish that I will make again

and again and again now that I know it's not 
as complicated as it seems so the recipe as

always will be on Pais kitchen com when you 
make it send me a photo on Facebook Twitter

or Instagram I am also on Pinterest if you 
are pinners and if you haven't subscribed to

the show make sure you do so you don't miss a 
recipe and when you do click that little bell

icon so you get a notification when I post a 
new video if you love the show and you want to

support us check out our patreon link in 
the description below and I will see you

next time for your next delicious adventure 
just a little bit and a little bit of salt
